thread.title: Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide
thread.title_full: Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Italian village torn apart by slow-moving landslide
text:
Thirty-three homes have been evacuated and nearly 100 people left homeless by a landslide which is tearing apart the village of Ponzano in Italy.
Officials say a hill has been cut in two, and the landslide is moving at a rate of a metre a day.
The village is in the Abruzzo region, which was hit by a string of earthquakes in 2016.
